function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increased focus on occupant health in building design and operation due to recent pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Data-related challenges for achieving design and operation of healthy buildings.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of pandemic on building professionals’ perspective regarding buildings’ impact on occupant health.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airborne transmission of viruses in indoor environments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Surface-touch contamination as a mode of virus transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Generalizing results from a sample dominated by engineers, architects, and facility managers","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Pandemic bias effect on questionnaire responses","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased focus on physical and mental well-being in building occupant health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on questionnaires as the primary method for studying and measuring occupant health may lead to incomplete or biased data.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Major focus on office buildings in research studies and practice-based efforts may neglect other types of buildings that also impact occupant health.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of understanding about the effect of building attributes on occupant health","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Absence of an effective collaboration framework between different stakeholders of a building","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased focus on occupant health in building design, construction, and operation due to the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Greater attention to ventilation systems to maintain high indoor air quality and limit infection in indoor spaces.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to consider the trade-off and synergies between energy efficiency, sustainability, and occupant health","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of * for experimental/laboratory studies without specifying the building type","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of clear and commonly accepted definition of ’healthy building’","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited systematic process to incorporate who’s definitions of health in buildings","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of flexibility in building design to adapt to changes without compromising occupant well-being","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emerging environmental concerns such as climate change and pollution may lead to an increased risk of contagious diseases in buildings.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global epidemics of stress and longer working hours may impact occupant mental and social well-being in buildings.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor indoor air quality due to contaminants from outdoor and indoor sources","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Elevated negative emotions, aggressive behaviors, and mental fatigue due to indoor air contaminants","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of sbs symptoms due to high air temperature exceeding 22°c","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of exposure to natural light affecting mood, sleep quality, and vitamin d levels","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate access to natural views contributing to job stress in office workers","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Noise pollution in buildings from various sources impacting occupant well-being and health","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Disease outbreaks due to poor water quality and distribution in buildings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of physical activity opportunities in buildings leading to occupant health issues","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor building design contributing to the spread of contagious diseases through close proximity and shared facilities.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation and air quality leading to the accumulation of airborne contaminants and pathogens.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of outdoor access and green spaces leading to poor mental and physical health.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of widely accepted occupant health assessment standard","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Commercial off-the-shelf sensors for ieq parameters","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through contact with shared biomarker measurement devices , thermal cameras, sensors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of increased infection through contact with commonly touched surfaces during occupant health assessments , survey instruments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of discussion and consideration of contagious disease transmission risk in the literature on occupant health assessment tools","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Building guidelines may not prioritize occupant health","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low certification numbers for health-focused building standards","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate thermal comfort causing discomfort and reduced productivity for occupants","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient visual comfort leading to eye strain, fatigue, and reduced cognitive performance for occupants","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to toxic heavy metals in green buildings due to the use of fly ash in construction materials","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Sub-standard building conditions in low-income and minority households","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate housing conditions leading to poor indoor air quality","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Residential segregation based on race and ethnicity","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Higher level of indoor air pollutants in african american and hispanic houses","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Racial segregation and lower housing standards leading to health burden on children","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Children studying in schools near highways exposed to hazardous pollutants","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate working conditions for laborers and employees in blue collar jobs","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of integration between social, environmental scientists and engineers in developing a framework of health in the built environment","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"}]}
